abstract: Joaquín Almunia, the European competition commissioner, has been open to a settlement with Google on claims it abused its dominance.
snippet: Joaquín Almunia, the European competition commissioner, has been open to a settlement with Google on claims it abused its dominance.
lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — For the past two years, Google has worked hard to avoid facing formal antitrust charges in Europe that could mean years of expensive litigation and encourage the authorities in other parts of the world to take comparable action.

headline.main: Change of Tone Could Help Google in European Antitrust Case
headline.print_headline: Changes in Europe Could Help Google In Antitrust Case
